title: Drawing, "Achilles Drags the Body of Hector around Walls of Troy; Priam Pleads for the Body of Hector: Ceiling Design for the Galleria di Achille, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1802–05
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray-brown wash over traces of graphite on white laid paper
inscribed:
Inscribed above each image in graphite: furia d'Achille/ 6; 
At center in graphite: 7 priamo prega per il corpo d ettore
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Two lunette shaped drawings on one sheet. In upper drawing, Achilles drags body of Hector around city of Troy. In lower drawing, Priam, in the tent of Achilles, kneels before Achilles and kisses his right hand; some warriors watch the scene and others look at Priam's gifts.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Achilles Drags the Body of Hector around Walls of Troy; Priam Pleads for the Body of Hector: Ceiling Design for the Galleria di Achille, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1802–05.
1802–05. Pen and brown ink, brush and gray-brown wash over traces of graphite on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3329.
